input_args.passage: 'George Albert Smith - Church History | George Albert Smith, Eighth President of the Church While employed in the Federal Land Office for Utah, he was called at the age of 33 to the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles. Despite fragile health and impaired eyesight, he had a distinguished career as a Church leader. He became President of the Church on May 21, 1945., Eighth President of the Church'
input_args.claim: 'From the sources provided, it is evident that George Albert Smith played a significant role in the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints as he was the eighth president of the church.'
